intro: Ageratina manantlana, commonly known as the mountain ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its inflorescence consists of blue to purple florets. Ageratina manantlana is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
